page.title: 18PEOPLE WITH MEMORIES
page.content: We interviewed a lady about her life when she was small. She was born in the village,her father owned a butchers shop and when she left school she helped in the shop. There were a lot of shops in the village then but now there's only one. People used to go stone picking in the fields, the stones were used for road repairs. When the first car went down the road everyone came to watch. It was a major event! Few people owned a pony and trap, her father had one because he had the shop. There was no electricity, TV, videos and computers.In the mornings they filled the oil lamps up ready for the evening. " I don't like the way the countryside has changed because some farmers have ploughed right over the public rights of way" she told us.
